Key Match Events: England's highly-anticipated Men’s T20 World Cup match against Australia in Melbourne was washed out without a ball being bowled.
Persistent afternoon rain left the outfield saturated, and despite a two-hour period without rain, the match was called off at 20:48 local time.
The match was called off to boos from those inside the ground, with the playing surface deemed unfit for play.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler said: 'The umpires had some big concerns and rightly so because the outfield was very wet and there were some areas in the 30-yard circle that were not fit to play.'
Australia captain Aaron Finch said: 'The outfield has taken a drenching over the last couple of weeks and that’s the worst I’ve seen it in this stadium.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Melbourne has been dogged by the La Nina weather pattern, which has caused serious flooding in parts of Victoria.
There have now been four matches in the tournament to finish without a result because of the weather.
